intro: Lindenia vitiensis, commonly known as the Vitiensis Lindenia, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in tropical regions.
